intro: Filago bornmuelleri, commonly known as the mountain filago, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in cold and arid conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and hairy, adapted to reduce water loss in harsh climates. The flowers are small and yellow, often appearing in clusters, and bloom during the summer months.
